bug.author: turner-anderson
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I've noticed that when using st.image(), the message: "/image/jpeg" or "image/png", depending on format, is being printed into my console. This only seems to happen on Windows, but not when I'm using Windows Subsystem for Linux to launch the server. I believe it's happened in both a Jupyter terminal and PowerShell for me. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug: Example script: <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st from PIL import Image img = Image.open("<your_image>") st.image(img) </denchmark-code>
Launch the server, and navigate to your console, where you'll see 'image/jpeg'. If you add a trailing space or new line and save, when the code reruns you'll get a new message. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I would expect no log message. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Messages are being printed to the log Screenshot: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61035514/91127276-eb357c80-e673-11ea-9852-0289bab448b3.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
I've never noticed it before <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.65.2 Python version: 3.7.3 Conda OS version: Windows 10.0.18362 Build 18362 Browser version: Chrome 84.0.4147.135

comments.comment: Hey, sorry about this! A recent code change introduced a stray print() statement in our latest release 0.65.2. We've already removed it from our source code (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/commit/7294ac77febd16b394f32c6e1d23038ee7f12a03>7294ac7</denchmark-link> ) so this will be fixed in our next release (in a week or two); in the meantime, our <denchmark-link:https://docs.streamlit.io/en/stable/pre_release_features.html#nightly-releases>nightlies</denchmark-link> should also have this resolved. And of course, thanks for raising the issue!
